column3: The mission of OpenAI is to ensure AGI benefits all of humanity, which means both building safe and beneficial AGI and helping create distributed benefits. We are now sharing what we've learned about achieving our mission. We intend to dismiss all of Elonâ€™s claims.

column1: Disrupting malicious uses of AI by state-affiliated threat actors
column3: State-affiliated groups pose unique risks to digital ecosystem and human welfare. We terminated accounts associated with state-affiliated threat actors. The activities of these actors are consistent with previous red team assessments, which found that GPT-4 offers only limited, incremental capabilities for malicious cybersecurity tasks.

column1: Memory and new controls for ChatGPT
column3: Remembering things you discuss across all chats saves you from having to repeat information and makes future conversations more helpful. As you chat with ChatGPT, you can ask it to remember something specific or let it pick up details. You can turn off memory at any time.

column1: New embedding models and API updates
column3: We are releasing new models, reducing prices for GPT-3.5 Turbo and new API usage management tools. We are introducing two new embedding models: a smaller and more efficient model and a larger model. The new models include a smaller, more efficient and more powerful model.

column1: Democratic inputs to AI grant program: lessons learned and implementation plans
column3: We funded 10 teams from around the world to design ideas and tools to collectively govern AI. In May, we awarded $100,000 to 10 teams out of nearly 1000 applicants to design, build, and test ideas that use democratic methods to decide the rules that govern AI systems.
